#Text=At least 45 killed in new wave of violence in Kenya
#Text=Sunday , January 27 , 2008
#Text=At least 45 people have been killed in a new surge of violence that began after Kenya 's disputed December 27 presidential election .
#Text=Some sources have said that there have been over 80 deaths in the last 3 days .
#Text=The latest deaths come as former U.N. secretary-general
#Text=Kofi Annan is in Kenya to try to broker a compromise .
#Text=Police had imposed an overnight curfew in the city of Nakuru , about two hours north of Nairobi , after new violence broke out on Friday .
#Text=The killings appear to be ethnically motivated , as Kikuyus seek revenge for attacks against their fellow tribesmen in recent weeks .
#Text=Officials estimate that nearly 800 people have been killed since the vote , which saw President Mwai Kibaki , a Kikuyu , defeat opposition candidate Raila Odinga by just 230,000 votes .
#Text=Odinga supporters from the Luo , Kalenjin and other smaller ethnic groups claim the election was stolen , and international observers say the vote was flawed .
#Text=Widespread anger at the election results sparked violence in Nairobi 's slums and parts of the west , and tens of thousands of Kikuyus fled their homes .
#Text=The violence had largely died down in recent days , but has erupted again in Nakuru .
#Text=Police also said Saturday that at least 15 people have been killed in the town of Molo , west of Nakuru .
#Text=The two towns are in the Rift Valley , an ethnically mixed area that has seen violence in the past over land and resources .

#Text=The Kalenjins had already pushed and got the Kikuyus earlier so what they are doing is the Kikuyus are trying to revenge and get back their places , get back their houses — Jimmy Mucheru , resident of Nakuru

#Text=" The Kalenjins had already pushed and got the Kikuyus earlier so what they are doing is the Kikuyus are trying to revenge and get back their places , get back their houses , " said Jimmy Mucheru , who is a local safari guide in Nakuru .
#Text="

#Text= What we saw was rather tragic , " he noted .

column1: #Text=" We visited several IDP camps , we saw people pushed from their homes , from their farms , grandmothers , children , families uprooted .
#Text="
